page.title: 15HESSLE ROAD HULL
page.content: This road was once famous as the centre of the fishing trade but as that industry has gone into decline so has the area. During the war this part of town suffered a great deal due to it being very close to the docks, however it was not until 1956 that the first slums were cleared. That street was Marmaduke St and it was not re-developed until 1976. During the clearance work people from the area have been moved to estates such as Orchard Park and Bransholme, but many have been re-housed in the area as 3,600 new homes have been built to replace the ones torn down. Not only houses have been built though as new schools and industry have also been set up. The South Orbital road has been built to carry traffic to the docks. The area once dominated by fishing now has a new character.
